text: Gladys del Carmen Marín Millie (; July 18, 1937 - March 6, 2005) was a Chilean activist and politician. She was Secretary-General of the Communist Party of Chile (PCCh) from 1994 until 2002 and then president of the PCCh until her death. She was a critic of General Augusto Pinochet and accused him of committing human rights violations during his seventeen-year dictatorship. Marín died of brain cancer on March 6, 2005 in Santiago, Chile at the age of 66. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:2005 deaths Category:Communist politicians Category:Chilean politicians Category:Chilean human rights activists
